content.description: With a horizontal shelf at the start and the first bolt at about fifteen feet up, the crux of this route is the first two bolts. The first move off the shelf is committing and the bolt is just out of reach. The first two bolts are steep and a huge hole after the second bolt allows you some rest. The angle eases off for five more bolts before you arrive at the chains. A challenging and fun route that makes you commit.
content.protection: 7 bolts and the chains. There were carabiners in chains as of 2010-07-09. A stick clip would be good for the first bolt.
content.location: .1 miles west of the Bear Hollow parking, on the north side of the road. This route faces southwest. Park along the road and scramble up 50 feet to the base of the route.
